title: Inductance - current when V is beta t-squared

content.question: What is the magnitude of the current in the inductor as a function of time?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction 2 beta over L, end fraction, times t" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>β</mi></mrow><mi>L</mi></mfrac><mi>t</mi></math>
<math alttext="the fraction beta over L, end fraction, times t squared" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>β</mi><mi>L</mi></mfrac><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="the fraction beta over 3 L, end fraction, times t cubed" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>β</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>L</mi></mrow></mfrac><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction beta over 3 L, end fraction, times t cubed" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>β</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>L</mi></mrow></mfrac><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
